```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# Attach Packages
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
```

## Read in the data

```{r}
ucsb_grad <- read_csv(here("data","ucsb_grad_data.csv"))
```
```{r}
##creating ggplot 

ggplot(data = ucsb_grad, aes(y = domestic_enrollment , x = year_abbr)) + 
  geom_col(position= "fill", aes(fill = ethnicity)) + 
  labs(x= "Year", y= "Domestic Enrollment", fill = "Ethnicity" , 
       title = "Ethnicity of UCSB Graduates (2008 - 2019)") + 
  theme_minimal()
```
Figure 1. The ethnicities of UCSB graduate students from 2008-2019. UCSB graduates are majority a large White population. Other ethnicities have slightly increased over the years, specifically Black, Asian/Pacific Islander, and Chicano.
